sub_title: Chairman of Association for the Study of EthnoGeoPolitics /Risk Analysis / INTERNATIONAL CONSULTANCY/ Full Professor Policy Advisor
summary:
Policy Advice and Consultancy, Research and Investigation, Fact Finding, Political and Finacial (risk) Analysis, (Public Intelligence),Training and Curriculum Development Problem Solving, Negotiation.


I am always available for, and new tasks and  services. 
Please leave behind your email and/or phone '. 

"I am a simple person” says Babak Rezvani. However, he is a multifaceted person with diverse kind of declarative (facts) and procedural (know how) knowledge. You will never regret from contacting him!

Dr Babak Rezvani is a professional consultant and adviser, and offers different services such as policy advice, advocacy, and (policy-relevant) research and recommendations to a broad range of clients such as governments, NGOs, local authorities, universities, political parties, businessmen, members of parliament, and commercial companies, from Africa, the Americas, Asia, Europe, Post-Soviet countries, the Middle East.

He is also experienced as a personal adviser and coach and offers training for individual or groups.  
Applying various qualitative and quantitative methods of investigation and research, and using various sources of data and Intelligence, he finds answers to and solutions for all your professional questions and problems. He has a broad network, and maintains professional contacts with many experts, in different fields and in different countries.

Depending on your request, one person or a team of experts will work on your queries. They always find answers to your questions and offer you informed advice and satisfactory solutions.

You can hire him and his associates as lecturers, trainers or mediators of conflict management and resolution. He (often together with a team of colleagues) offers economic and political analysis. He also offers his services (as a coach) in academic writing, and in making programs, and project plans. 

Our hourly rates depend on the task or project and are negotiable after we reach a mutually accepted agreement.

As a non-profit organisation, we seek to achieve this by:

offering guest lectures for existing courses, or courses developed by ourselves, related to ethnogeopolitics or kindred issues and disciplines at universities, institutes and colleges inside and outside the Netherlands.
encouraging debate on ethnogeopolitical topics and research findings, as presented in our new journal Forum of EthnoGeoPolitics (see link ‘Publications’).
providing or participating in teaching modules and materials on ethnogepolitical concepts, research methods, topics, regions and research findings for universities, institutes and colleges in and outside the Netherlands.
